entry.title: Jim Morrison poem found in Paris hotel room being auctioned
entry.summary: NEW YORK (AP) - A handwritten poem by Jim Morrison found among his possessions in the Paris hotel where he died in 1971 ends with the line "Last words, Last words out."

entry.title: Poem by Jim Morrison found in hotel room where he died is being auctioned online
entry.summary:
Morrison was the lead singer of the 1960s rock group the Doors.

This undated photo provided by Paddle8 shows a hand-written poem by Jim Morrison that is being auctioned, with bidding expected to reach 60,000 to $80,000 by the time it ends June 25.

entry.title: Jim Morrison poem found in Paris hotel room being auctioned
Jim Morrison poem found in Paris hotel room being auctioned
entry.summary:
Morrison moved to Paris in 1971 to take a break from performing and to focus on his writing.

It's written in Morrison's own hand, deals with the themes of death and snakes, and was found in the hotel where he died.

entry.title: Van Morrison on 'Re-Working the Catalogue' with an all-star lineup
entry.summary:
That number increased with Monday's release of Morrison's new album, "Duets: Re-Working the Catalogue."

For Morrison, "There were two parts to it," the 69-year-old artist told The Times in an exclusive email interview.

Morrison has spent the vast majority of his career looking ahead, writing and recording a string of studio albums that now numbers more than three dozen; "Duets: Re-Working the Catalogue" represents a rare dip into his past.

During that event, Morrison invited Staples, Womack and Cole to go into a recording studio to get the ball rolling.

"I first heard him in the '60s at a show with Aretha Franklin and Dr. John and I thought then, 'Who is this guy?'" Mahal told The Times at a performance Morrison gave last summer outside his hometown of Belfast.

The album is produced by Morrison with Don Was and Bob Rock.

entry.title: Morrison flags suspended citizenship
entry.summary: Mr Morrison, the former immigration minister who is now in the social services portfolio, said a way forward could be allowing temporary suspension of citizenship.

entry.title: Too many Rohingya to settle: Morrison
entry.summary:
Social services minister Scott Morrison says people who suggest countries in the region can resettle persecuted Rohingya misunderstand the scale of the problem.

Mr Morrison says he has visited Rohingya displacement camps and the issue is more complex than advocates made out.

entry.title: Morrison holds form to win Spanish Open
entry.summary: Despite pressure from Howell, Francesco Molinari and defending champion Miguel Angel Jimenez a run of eight straight pars took Morrison to the 18th three shots clear of the chasing field.

entry.title: Morrison wins by 4 in Spain
entry.summary:
Barcelona, Spain (SportsNetwork.com) - James Morrison shot a 3-under 69 in Sunday's final round and the Englishman went on to win by four shots at the Open de Espana.

Morrison, who shared the third-round lead with David Howell, finished the week at 10-under-par 278.

entry.title: James Morrison of England wins Spanish Open by 4 shots
entry.summary: James Morrison of England won the Spanish Open by four shots after shooting a 3-under 69 in Sunday's final round.

entry.title: Britons Morrison and Howell lead way as Sergio surges
entry.summary: BARCELONA, May 16 (Reuters) - Britons James Morrison and David Howell both overcame double-bogeys to share the lead after the third round of the Spanish Open on Saturday.

entry.title: Britons Morrison and Howell lead way as Sergio surges
entry.summary: Morrison carded a four-under 68 on another day of blustery weather at the Real Club de Golf El Prat on the outskirts of Barcelona to join Howell (69) on seven-under 209.

entry.title: England's Morrison, Howell lead Spanish Open after 3 rounds
entry.summary:
Morrison recovered from a double bogey on the second hole by making seven birdies the rest of the way, with one bogey.

"It's been three very silly days," Morrison said.

entry.title: England's Morrison, Howell lead Spanish Open after 3 rounds
entry.summary:
TERRASA, Spain (AP) " English duo James Morrison and David Howell shared a two-shot lead Saturday after the third round of the Spanish Open.

Morrison carded a 4-under 68 while Howell shot 69 to leave both on a total of 7-under 209 entering Sunday's final round at the Real Club de Golf El Prat.

entry.title: Morrison rejects Labor super tax changes
entry.summary: Social Services Minister Scott Morrison has given the clearest indication yet the government will not accept a Labor proposal to tax the superannuation income of wealthy retirees.

entry.title: Fans push to preserve Jim Morrison's New Mexico home
entry.summary: The elder Morrison commanded U.S. ships in the Gulf of Tonkin during the clash that helped escalate the Vietnam War.

entry.title: Fans push to preserve Jim Morrison's New Mexico home
entry.summary: The 1960s singer of hits such as "Light My Fire" and "Riders on the Storm" lived in Albuquerque from age 12 to 14 while his father, George S. Morrison, worked at Kirtland Air Force Base.

entry.title: Fans push to preserve Jim Morrison's New Mexico home
entry.summary:
The young Morrison attended Monroe and Wilson middle schools.

In the biography "No One Here Gets Out Alive," Jim Morrison speaks of witnessing a car accident in the desert involving an American Indian family where some might have died.

entry.title: Fans push to preserve Jim Morrison's New Mexico home
entry.summary:
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) " Fans of Jim Morrison, the late singer for The Doors, are in a push to preserve his childhood home in New Mexico.

Historian and fan Anthony Gomez says because Morrison spent important years in New Mexico's biggest city, his childhood home should be protected as a remembrance.

Morrison's family later moved to Alexandria, Virginia.

The Melbourne, Florida-born Morrison died in July 1971 at the age of 27 in a Paris bathtub.

entry.title: Home runs by Cruz, Morrison lead Mariners to win over Angels
entry.summary: Two batters later, Morrison jumped all over a 1-0 changeup from Shoemaker, depositing it into the right field seats to make it 2-0.

entry.title: Morrison wants jobs for young, vulnerable
entry.summary: Social Services Minister Scott Morrison says the government's jobs package in the May 12 budget is aimed at getting young people into work, particularly those in vulnerable communities.

entry.title: No cut for stay-at-home mums: Morrison
entry.summary:
Social Services Minister Scott Morrison has dismissed reports the federal government plans to cut payments to stay-at-home parents.

While childcare subsidies focused on supporting working parents, those who looked after children at home got support through other measures, Mr Morrison said in response to a report that non-working parents would no longer be able to claim the childcare rebate or benefit.

entry.title: Morrison's tiebreaking double helps Mariners beat Rangers
entry.summary:
Logan Morrison had a tiebreaking, two-run double to back Felix Hernandez and lead the Seattle Mariners to a 5-2 victory over the Texas Rangers on Wednesday night.

With the score tied 2-2 and the bases loaded in the fifth inning, Morrison hit a ground ball past first base against Texas starter Wandy Rodriguez (0-1).

Morrison finished 4 for 5, including two hits against Rodriguez to improve to 7 for 14 in his career against the left-hander.

Morrison then bounced a grounder that eluded the reach of first baseman Kyle Blanks and went into the right-field corner as two runs scored.

entry.title: The magic is missing in Toni Morrison's 'God Help the Child'
entry.summary: Deep in the center of Toni Morrison's 11th novel, "God Help the Child," there's a section that resonates with the power of the author's finest work.

entry.title: Say thanks for negative gearing: Morrison
Say thanks for negative gearing: Morrison
entry.summary:
"There is an urban myth running around that negative gearing is the province of the rich and should be for the high jump," Social Services Minister Scott Morrison wrote in the Daily Telegraph on Friday.

The data clearly showed negative gearing was something middle Australia used to help build their household wealth, chief executive Ken Morrison said.

entry.title: Morrison's 'God Help the Child' excavates characters' self-image with a touch of magical realism
entry.summary:
It's as hard as ever to pick nits in Morrison's writing.

You'll also find a touch of what could be called Morrison's magical realism, a term that has always felt a little trite.

entry.title: Toni Morrison sets her new novel in an alien world: Today
entry.summary:
"'I was pretty once,' she thought, 'real pretty, and I believed it was enough,'" Morrison writes in the novel of Sweetness.

Writing is Morrison's path to outside of herself, but it's undertaken alone, in her imagination: The Civil War era in "Beloved," the 1920s in "Jazz," colonial times in "A Mercy."

entry.title: Toni Morrison sets her new novel in an alien world: Today
entry.summary:
Morrison's latest book, "God Help the Child," will be released on Tuesday, April 21, 2015.

NEW YORK (AP) - Toni Morrison has written 11 novels and won all the great prizes, but found herself struggling with her new book, "God Help the Child."

There are no stand-ins for Morrison in her novel, no one who lives even remotely like the world famous, 84-year-old Nobel laureate.

Morrison believes her job as a writer is to upend conventional thinking, whether about race (a social construct, she calls it), or happiness.

entry.title: ?Glee? star Matthew Morrison works tirelessly to drive overbearing ?Finding Neverland?
entry.summary: Matthew Morrison and Kelsey Grammer in "Finding Neverland."

entry.title: East-West Link payout obscene: Morrison
entry.summary: "For the Victorian government to spend $420 million to pay to a company not to build a road is an obscenity," Mr Morrison told reporters in the NSW Illawarra region.

entry.title: 'Glee' star Matthew Morrison finds himself back on Broadway
entry.summary: While he's been away from New York, Morrison has seen the profile of Broadway and theater increase, in part due to shows like "Glee" and "Smash."

entry.title: 'Glee' star Matthew Morrison finds himself back on Broadway
entry.summary:
Morrison, 36, plays J.M. Barrie, the "Peter Pan" author, in the adaptation from the 2004 whimsical film of the same name about a widow whose four young sons inspired Barrie to write the children's classic.

Morrison had previously starred on Broadway in "Hairspray," ''South Pacific" and "The Light in the Piazza," for which he was nominated for a 2005 Tony Award.

entry.title: 'Glee' star Matthew Morrison finds himself back on Broadway
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - It's taken six years for Matthew Morrison to get back on Broadway so it's no surprise he knows a thing or two about where he ended up.

"I just imagine her welcome guests back in her pearls and everything," Morrison said, sipping tea.

"There's nothing more challenging or exciting than doing a brand new Broadway show," said Morrison.

The show ended earlier this year and Morrison's last scene was of him singing "Teach Your Children" by Crosby Stills, Nash & Young in dedication to all his fictional students, many who are in tears by the end of the song.

Morrison barely had time to say goodbye to Schuester before it was time to tackle Barrie.
